snippet.title: Moscow: Looking for Capital Around The World
snippet.description: What does the Russian government do when it learns that international investors are afraid of its corruption and tough business climate and are not in a rush to come to the land of matryoshkas and fur coats? It sets up “Destination Moscow Roadshow 2013” to inform the world that Russia [...] read »

snippet.title: A 1980s Cold War Kid's View From Moscow
snippet.description: A Forbes writer who came of age in the Cold War makes a second trip to Moscow and sees the future...of the Middle East. read »

snippet.title: The Real Russian Revolution: On the Moscow Dinner-plate
snippet.description: Revolution Kommeth: Anatoly Komm If star Russian chef Anatoly Komm has his way, it won't just be Russian oil that the rising East devours by the barrel. Sally speaks to him, as he prepares for his Russian gourmet roadshow... In recent weeks, Moscow has been a theatre for the unthinkable. December's groundswell [...] read »

snippet.title: Pussy Riot Coming To New York (For One Night Only) To Launch US Tour
snippet.description: A one-night-only exhibition of Pussy Riot's videos brings the controversial group, arrested in Moscow for a performance art piece, to the American public. read »

snippet.title: Elizabeth Taylor Collection Tour Begins in September
snippet.description: Elizabeth Taylor was an iconic figure for millions and a major part of her attraction was her unbridled passion for luxury. The world will now have a chance to share in that passion when many of her most cherished items will be exhibited on a world tour before going up [...] read »

snippet.title: Cheney Strikes At Moscow Policies
snippet.description: The vice president's harsh words signal a fading friendship between the U.S. and Russia. read »

snippet.title: Is The Iran Deal Good Or Bad?
snippet.description: Here's the most self-evident truth about the Sunday deal in Geneva on Iran's nuclear program: don't trust anyone who has a stridently categorical view on the matter. The sanest observers have correctly argued that it constitutes a first step on a long, hard road and that includes Messrs Obama and [...] read »

snippet.title: Facebook's $2 Billion Purchase Of Oculus Is Just Crazy
snippet.description: Facebook’s purchase of Oculus is like Zeus killing a few random people with a lightning bolt; it's just something to do on a Tuesday afternoon. read »

snippet.title: India's PM Under Fire For Boycotting Commonwealth Confab Under Tamil Pressure
snippet.description: He had a summit with President Obama in the White House, and he saw China's President Xi Jinping in Beijing and Russia's President Vladimir Putin in Moscow all in a period of a few weeks. Yet Manmohan Singh, approaching the end of a decade as India's prime minister, won't be hobnobbing [...] read »

snippet.title: Disaster Of The Day: Moscow, We Have A Problem
snippet.description: The Russian government pulled the plug on the Mir space station, leaving many lost in space. read »
